soft.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: not hard, firm, or stiff, but easy to press
soft.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: My feet sank into the soft ground.
Cook the onions until they go soft.
soft.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: having a surface that is smooth and pleasant to touch
soft.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The fur was soft to the touch.
soft.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a soft sound or voice, or soft music, is quiet and pleasant to listen to
soft.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: soft colours or lights are pleasant and relaxing because they are not too bright
soft.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: All the stores will be re-fitted with softer lighting.
soft.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: not having any hard edges or sharp angles
soft.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: someone who is soft seems weak because they are not strict enough with other people
soft.translation[0].definitions[7].examp: If you appear to be soft, people take advantage of you.
Courts have been taking a soft line (=not being strict enough) with young offenders.
No politician wants to seem soft on crime.
soft.translation[0].definitions[8].defin: kind, gentle, and sympathetic to other people
soft.translation[0].definitions[8].examp: He has a soft heart beneath that cold exterior.
soft.translation[0].definitions[9].defin: not very brave and not having a strong character
soft.translation[0].definitions[10].defi: decreasing in price, value, or the amount sold
soft.translation[0].definitions[11].defi: a soft job, life etc is too easy and does not involve much work or hard physical work
soft.translation[0].definitions[11].exam: Mike’s found himself a soft job in the stores.
Taking the soft option won’t help your career to develop.
soft.translation[0].definitions[12].defi: having a body that is not in a strong physical condition, because you do not do enough exercise
soft.translation[0].definitions[12].exam: He’d got soft after all those years in a desk job.
soft.translation[0].definitions[13].defi: soft water does not contain many minerals, so that it forms bubbles from soap easily
soft.translation[0].definitions[14].exam: You must be soft if you think I’ll give you fifty quid!
soft.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: not hard, firm, or stiff, but easy to press
Her skin was lovely and soft.
used about meat or vegetables that are soft and easy to cut, especially because they have been well cooked
very wet and too soft, in a way that seems unpleasant – used about bread, vegetables, and the ground
The ground was too soggy to walk on.
soft and easy to press – used especially about fruit that is too soft, and about soft wet ground which makes a noise when you walk on it
The leaves were squishy under our feet.
soft and easy to press – used especially about fruit that is too soft, and about chairs that are soft and comfortable
The peaches have gone all squashy.
used about fruit or vegetables that are very soft, wet, and unpleasant, because they are not fresh or have been cooked for too long
soft and full of holes that contain air or liquid like a sponge
His boots sank into the spongy soil.
used about something that is soft and comes back to its normal shape after being pressed or walked on
Her hair felt lovely and springy.
used about a material or substance that can be bent or pressed without breaking or cracking
The clay was still pliable and not too dry.
used about a surface which is soft and will bend when you press it
soft.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: soft goods are used up soon after they are bought, for example food products
soft.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Ohio’s manufacturing base covers a wide range of soft and hard goods.
soft.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: soft loans or soft credit is money that is lent at a lower interest rate than normal, usually because it is for a project that is to be encouraged, for example a new business in an area of high unemployment
soft.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The fund was authorized to help the market by providing soft loans to institutional investors.
The mills got $73 million in soft credit to keep their gates open.
soft.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: a soft market or economy has prices that are falling because supply is greater than demand
soft.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: How do you sell your house in a soft market?
Our results continue to be adversely affected by a very soft regional economy.
soft.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: if sales, orders, demand etc are soft, there are not as many sales, orders etc or as much demand as usual
soft.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: Many retailers experienced soft sales in May and June.
The newspaper industry was suffering from a very soft demand for ad space.
